title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Part (a): 1 point

One point is earned for the correct definition of a hybrid regime.

An acceptable definition is: 

A hybrid regime has elements of both democracy and authoritarianism.

Note: Definitions that identify hybrid regimes as illiberal or transitional regimes are not sufficient. Definitions that refer only to deficiencies in democratic institutions and processes are not sufficient. Definitions need to reflect both authoritarian and democratic elements
descriptions: The student response earned zero points for an off-task answer or an attempted answer that merits no points.

The student provided a correct definition of a hybrid regime. 

An acceptable definition is:  

A hybrid regime has elements of both democracy and authoritarianism.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Part (b): 1 point

One point is earned for correctly identifying Russia as a hybrid regime AND China as an authoritarian regime.
descriptions: The student response earned no points for an off-task answer or an attempted answer that merits no points.
The student correctly identified Russia as a hybrid regime AND China as an authoritarian regime.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

One point is earned for descriptions of characteristics of TWO of the elements of Russia’s political system.

One point is earned for each correct explanation (for a total of 2 points) of how TWO of the following characteristics contribute to the regime designation in Russia.

Note: Description and explanation must be linked.

Note: The examples below are not exhaustive; they are meant to illustrate the need to responses to reflect both authoritarianism and democratic elements.

Elements

  • Electoral

    • Acceptable description include - Multiparty elections

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT some parties are excluded from electoral process

  • Competition

    • Acceptable description include - Some parties excluded

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT elections include parties other than United Russia

  • Civil

    • Acceptable description include - NGOs, mass protests allowed

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT they are restricted, leaders sometimes arrested

  • Society

    • Acceptable description include - Restrictions on NGOs, protests

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT some NGOs and mass protests are allowed

  • Media

    • Acceptable description include - Small market media mostly

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT some NGOs and mass protests are allowed

    • Acceptable description include - Large market media government owned, controlled

    • Acceptable explanation include - BUT small market media mostly free

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
3 points maximum

One point is earned for descriptions of characteristics of TWO of the elements of China’s political system.

One point is earned for each correct explanation (for a total of 2 points) of how TWO of the following characteristics contribute to the regime designation in China.

Note: Description and explanation must be linked.

Note: Response must highlight authoritarian elements. albeit limited democratic elements are possible.

Note: The examples below are not exhaustive; they are meant to illustrate the need for responses to connect the description of elements of the political system in China to a central authority.

Elements

  • Electoral Competition

    • Acceptable description include - Real electoral competition is not allowed

    • Acceptable explanation include - BY the state and/or the Communist Party

  • Civil Society

    • Acceptable description include - There is widespread persecution of activist

    • Acceptable explanation include - BY the government

  • Media

    • Acceptable description include - Media are widely censored

    • Acceptable explanation include - BY the leadership/party elites
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.
